    • Constructor Detail

      • Transform

        public Transform(DataTable selectedTable)
        Constructor - Create an Transform object by DataTable. One Transform object is responsible for only one DataTable.
        Parameters:
        selectedTable - - DataTable for making Transformation

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public Transform clone()
                throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Clone the whole Transform object.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the cloned Transform object
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException - - throws exception if there are elements that clone does not support

      • colToRow

        public java.lang.String[][] colToRow()
        Convert selected DataTable to rowList. Used only in constructor.
        Returns:
        rowList - the 2D array corresponding to the DataTable

      • filterData

        public java.lang.String[][] filterData(java.lang.String cSelected,
                                       java.lang.String comparison,
                                       double v)
        Filter the data by inputed conditions. Keep the row if the row value in [cSelected] column [comparison] [v]. E.g. Keep the row if the row value in column with title "age" > 18, for cSelected = "age", comparison = ">" and v = 18.
        Parameters:
        cSelected - - column which the filter based on
        comparison - - comparison operator
        v - - value for comparison
        Returns:
        the filtered list of data

      • splitData

        public boolean splitData(double percentage)
        Split the data into 2 sets with ratio [percentage : 100-percentage]. Save the 2 sets of data into splitedOne and splitedTwo array. If there is case such as only one column, the data cannot be split and return false.
        Parameters:
        percentage - - the percentage for splitting
        Returns:
        true if the data set can be split corresponding to the percentage.

      • getNumColName

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getNumColName()
        Get the list of all column names which column type is Number
        Returns:
        list of all column names which column type is Number

      • getColName

        public java.lang.String[] getColName()
        Get the list of all column names
        Returns:
        list of all column names

      • getRowList

        public java.lang.String[][] getRowList()
        Get the 2d list of selected data from init screen. It will not be changed even if filtering has applied. If split is performed, this Transform object will be deleted after split. Two new Transform objects will be created. 2 rowList of the 2 new Transform objects will be changed to the splitedOne and splitedTwo respectively.
        Returns:
        2d list of original data

      • getFilteredList

        public java.lang.String[][] getFilteredList()
        Get the 2d list of data after applying filter. It will be equal to rowList if filtering has not yet applied. It will be equal to rowList after split has been applied and before filter has been applied.
        Returns:
        2d list of filtered data

      • getNumRowOfFilteredList

        public int getNumRowOfFilteredList()
        Get the number of row of filteredList
        Returns:
        number of row of filteredList

      • getNumColOfFilteredList

        public int getNumColOfFilteredList()
        Get the number of column of filteredList
        Returns:
        number of column of filteredList

      • getFirstSplitedT

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getFirstSplitedT()
        Get the 2D array of 1st split table
        Returns:
        2D array of first split table

      • getSecondSplitedT

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> getSecondSplitedT()
        Get the 2D array of 2nd split table
        Returns:
        2D array of second split table

      • setRowList

        public void setRowList(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> rowlist)
        Set obeject's rowList to inputed rowlist.
        Parameters:
        rowlist - - 2D ArrayList of data to replace original rowList

      • toListwTitle

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> toListwTitle()
        onvert the 2D filtered list without title to 1D list with title.
        Returns:
        List of table with title
